title: Ghost of Tsushima Director’s Cut Review Round-Up - Kinda Funny Games Daily 08.19.21
description:
Go to http://canva.me/kfgd to get your FREE 45-day extended Canva Pro trial.

Go to http://hbom.ax/kfgd to sign up for HBO Max!

Go to http://kiwico.com/kindafunnygames to get 50% off your first month!

GameSpot's Tamoor Hussain joins Greg to talk Ghost reviews, CES vaccinations, and more! 

Follow Tam: https://twitter.com/tamoorh

Time Stamps - 
00:00:00 - Start
00:03:00 - Housekeeping
GameSpot’s Lucy James joins us to review Ghost of Tsushima Director’s Cut and 12 Minutes on the Kinda Funny Gamescast! It’s up now on youtube.com/kindafunnygames and podcast services!
Thank you to our Patreon Producer Black Jack.
The Roper Report   -
00:09:50 - Ghost of Tsushima Director’s Cut Review Round-Up
00:21:20 - Cyberpunk 2077 DLC Deets, Jeremy Winslow @ GameSpot
00:31:09 - Quakecon Leaks! Jared Moore @ IGN
00:39:15 - CES Requires the Vaccine
00:43:36 -  Ad
00:47:00 - Out today
00:55:00 - You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s Hosts:Greg and Ryan Penagos

okay yeah yeah yeah okay yeah let's go to gamespot they gave it goes to sushima director's cut and eight over there phil hornshaw writes all of what iki island brings to ghost of tsushima is good if you already like ghost of tsushima uh the base games issues remain however so if sucker punches take on the open world didn't thrill you before don't expect this new concept content to change your mind you'll still wrestle with the camera during combat especially as mongols come flooding at you from all sides and while iki island is a fun place to explore it's littered with a lot of the same by the number open world activities and collectibles expect to chase down a bunch of collectible flags and lore items climb a few lighthouses and try your hand at a few archery challenges none of these activities is especially engaging and while the side quest provides some good variety in their stories requirements and locations the island still has its share of busy work scattered around where iki

is especially engaging and while the side quest provides some good variety in their stories requirements and locations the island still has its share of busy work scattered around where iki island excels though is in adding some new dimensions to the rest of ghost of tsushima uh its exploration of jyn's backstory and his character bring more depth to the base game's tale that improve it overall and its beautiful new landscape provides both more of what works about vanilla ghost and a few good if slight tweaks on the formula nothing is a drastic departure but it's a lot more of the good stuff refreshing sucker punch is already solid open world game and providing some interesting reasons to revisit it and then finally we go to ign.com who also gave it an eight mitchell saltzman writes if more ghost of sushima is what you want the iki island expansion is exactly that it provides another compelling story that dives deep into jin's past a new and absolutely gorgeous island to explore

if more ghost of sushima is what you want the iki island expansion is exactly that it provides another compelling story that dives deep into jin's past a new and absolutely gorgeous island to explore that's full of meaningful collectibles and a couple of challenging additions to combat in the form of enemies that force you to think on your feet even more than before the quest design is disappointingly familiar to everything we've already played in the main game uh but any opportunity to revisit the stunning world the sucker bunch has made is one worth taking tam have you played director's cut and if not are you going to i have not played it yet but i will be playing it i got my uh copy of it downloaded or i have it downloading um so i'm excited to check it out i really like the original um ghost of sushima i think a lot of what people have said about it especially what um phil over at gamespot said um because obviously you gotta pick my own people but also what mitchell said uh is
